definition[0]: the state of being unable to pay your debts
example[0]: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
example[1]: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
definition[1]: a total lack of a particular good quality
definition[2]: when someone is judged to be unable to pay their debts by a court of law, and their assets are shared among the people and businesses that they owe money to
example[3]: Many state-operated companies had experienced difficulties and some had faced bankruptcy.
example[4]: The number of bankruptcies in the first half of the year soared by 60%.
